replies.bodyText: UI team suggested this and have implemented it accordingly and hiding radio button might not be a good user experience as it might confuse the user
replies.author: firdosebtc1

replies.bodyText: Honestly I'm a bit confused either way. But we may as well keep it this way. It might make more sense if the user could select the View/View and Edit, and the checkbox would automatically check? But I leave it up to the UI team's judgement.
replies.author: nikklassen

timeline.bodyText: "Creating a user" is more of a technical operation. "Add" works a bit better from the user's perspective. You could probably also make this just "Invite"

timeline.bodyText: nit: can you put the constructor after public/private properties?
timeline.author: nikklassen

timeline.bodyText: @ViewChildren is a safer way of getting elements from the DOM. But if the model (selectedApps) is updated when the check boxes are updated then do we really have to check both?
timeline.author: nikklassen

replies.bodyText: The requirement is to check if at least one permission (sites/study/app) has been given to the user ,I can check that with selectedApps but for that I need to loop through apps and studies and sites , so I have implemented in this way as I given name="checkbox2" in all the check-boxes as it avoids looping
replies.author: firdosebtc1

replies.bodyText: I prefer the looping solution because it corresponds better to the business logic here. It's not clear why certain checkboxes would be called "checkbox2". You also hardly ever see document.querySelector in an Angular application, it's generally a code smell.
replies.author: nikklassen

timeline.bodyText: This is a request to the apps API, so it would be better to put this in an AppService
timeline.author: nikklassen

timeline.message: code review comments has been resolved.

timeline.bodyText: Use params option instead of building the query
timeline.author: nikklassen

timeline.bodyText: Why is this different than getApps()? Can you use different function names to distinguish the difference?
timeline.author: nikklassen

replies.bodyText:
I have updated the method names ,
getAppsOfUser() is getting only the apps which the logged In user has permission and getAllAppsWithStudiesAndSites() is getting all apps irrespective of permission and along with studies and sites
replies.author: firdosebtc1

timeline.message: code review comments has been resolved

timeline.author: nikklassen

timeline.bodyText: This is an action, so we shouldn't be using titlecase. Invite should be lowercase.
timeline.author: nikklassen
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -462,9 +459,9 @@

Permissions

[disabled]="!addUserForm.form.valid" type="submit" name="add" - class="btn bt__add bt__add__auto mr-sm" + class="btn bt__add bt__add__auto mr-lg" > - Create User and Invite + Add user and Invite

timeline.bodyText: Can you remove the text-transform from labels? text-transform: capitalize doesn't really work, stopwords like "to" should always be lowercase, even in titles. But this isn't a title, so sentence case is correct for labels like this.
